code:
# @param {Integer} n
# @param {Integer} k
# @return {Integer[]}
def circular_game_losers(n, k)
  # Initialize an array to track if a friend has received the ball.
  received_ball = Array.new(n, false)

  # Starting position.
  current_position = 0

  # Iterate over each turn until the game ends.
  (1..n).each do |i|
    # Calculate the next position, wrapping around the circle.
    current_position = (current_position + (i * k) - 1) % n

    # Check if this friend has already received the ball.
    if received_ball[current_position]
      # Game ends, prepare the list of losers.
      losers = []
      received_ball.each_with_index do |received, index|
        losers << index + 1 unless received
      end
      return losers
    else
      # Mark this friend as having received the ball.
      received_ball[current_position] = true
    end
  end

  # If the game somehow doesn't end, return an empty array (though this shouldn't happen).
  []
end
